Summer Case Analysts @
 
 

Summer Case Analyst Program


Paravane Ventures’ Summer Case Analyst program allows college students to submit strategy proposals for cases involving real challenges our portfolio companies are tackling. The program is highly exclusive with an acceptance rate of about 0.5%

Our analysts have gone off to work in technology, consulting, venture capital, and related fields, at industry leaders including Google, Amazon, and McKinsey.

2018 Case Winners


Case One: EdTech Go-To-Market Strategy

Winner: Noah Cortez

Education: Stanford University

Major: Dual BA and BS, International Relations; Product Design; minor in Modern Languages (Arabic and Tagalog)

Noah's did a thorough analysis of the Orange County market complete with proof of concept's at specific schools. He coupled this with an idea to create a summer immersion experience for students with higher willingness to pay, in addition to our classroom curriculum offering.

Given that the education market is whale heavy (a small percentage of families have an extremely high willingness to pay which constitutes most of the market), creating a premium summer experience for the “whales” was a great idea to increase revenue.


Case Two: Event Management Software Growth Strategy

Winner: Grace Connor

Education: Stanford University

Major: Neuroscience

Grace demonstrated a clear understanding of the industry, competitors, and most importantly, the needs and painpoints experienced by a user of this software. Her recommendations were thorough and addressed the overarching strategy but also the minor, yet important modifications to improve the user experience. This included layout changes, planning services, plugin additions, partnership promotions and pre-made templates.

Overall, we were very impressed with Grace’s ability to envision how the product needs should evolve to meet the growth objectives of the company.
